title: User Interface design presentation
description:
Students are kindly requested to showcase their ongoing UI design projects to their respective project guides. Each student group will be allocated a 5-minute slot to present their current work and UI design. This allocation aims to prevent redundancy in discussing project scope and technical elements. Date and Time of Presentation: Aug 29, 2023, 11 AM onwards.¬†

Please adhere to the following sequence when creating the PPT slides:

Title Slide: Display the project title and student details.
Introduction: Provide a concise overview of the project, including its modules.
UI Design Presentation: Share UI design screenshots featuring relevant technologies and elements. Dedicate a separate slide for each screen.
Conclusive Remarks: Sum up the presentation by justifying the UI design, discussing the project scope, and highlighting its alignment with Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs).
Note:¬†You will be presenting to all four project guides. Please ensure that you share your presentation with your guide before presenting. Presentation is mandatory.

Dr. Vijay Arputharaj J

title: 14. Labels, Entry and Message box
description:
select a problem and Create a program that uses the above.
Eg.
Fibonacci
Factorial
Simple interest
Calculator
etc...


# The code we discussed in today's class for your reference


from tkinter import *
#from tkinter.messagebox import showinfo
from tkinter import messagebox
# root window
root = Tk()
root.geometry("300x150")
#root.resizable(False,False)
root.title('Sign In')



# email
email_label = Label(root, text="Email Address:",underline=0,bitmap='hourglass')
email_label.pack(fill='x', expand=True)

email_entry = Entry(root)
email_entry.pack(fill='x', expand=True)
email_entry.focus()


# password
password_label = Label(root, text="Password:",font= ('Helvetica 20 italic underline'),cursor='heart')
password_label.pack(fill='x', expand=True)

password_entry = Entry(root, ¬†show="a")
password_entry.pack(fill='x', expand=True)

# login button
login_button = Button(root, text="Login",command=lambda:messagebox.showinfo("Title","updated"))
login_button.pack(fill='x', expand=True, pady=10)


root.mainloop()

description:
Program should include the below
¬† ¬† ¬†Pass by value¬†
¬† ¬† ¬†Pass by reference
¬† ¬† ¬†All types of arguments
¬†¬†
Reference:

#Arguments
#Required arguments
def req_ex(c,d):
¬† ¬† return "Welcome to Functions"

#Default arguments
def default_ex(x, y=10):
¬† ¬† return(x+y)

#Keyword arguments
def kw_ex(x,y):
¬† ¬† return(x-y)

#Variable-length arguments
def var_ex(*args1):
¬† ¬† for i in args1:
¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† print(i)

def kwargs_ex(**kwargs):
¬† ¬† for key,val in kwargs.items():
¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† print(f"{key}={val}")
def dt_ex(n1:int, n2:int)->int:
¬† ¬† return n1

print(req_ex(4,2))
print(default_ex(10))
print(kw_ex(x=10,y=20))
var_ex(23)
var_ex(23,'Kunal',3.4)
kwargs_ex(a='yellow',b='Blue',c='white')
print(dt_ex([2,3,4,5],4))





#Pass by reference vs value
def passvalref(a,b):
¬† ¬† a=[1,2,3]
¬† ¬† a.append(10)
¬† ¬† 
¬† ¬† b.pop(2)
¬† ¬† print("x:",x , "y:",y)
¬† ¬† b.extend(['A','B','C'])

print("x: ¬†",x, "y: ¬†",y)

title: 5. Set
description:
Solve banking process using Set operations / functions in Python. Create the details for account holder, deposit and withdraw
¬† ¬† ¬†

Add the account number from 20 to 50, if it is¬† only prime number
List out who involved only with withdraw¬†¬† ¬† ¬† ¬†List out who involved only with deposit¬† ¬† ¬† ¬†
List out who are all not involved in deposit and withdraw¬†¬†
Remove the account numbers from the set if it is even number

Reference:
#Set Functions
#Adds an element to the set
grade={'A','B','C','D'}
grade.add('O')
print("After Addding", grade)

#copy of the set
new_grade=grade.copy()
print("Copied set",new_grade)

#if the given sets have no common elements
nums = {1,3 }
oddNums = {1, 3, 5, 7, 9}
print("Is there any Common elements? ¬†", nums.isdisjoint(oddNums))

#if the set contains every element of the other set passed as an argument
print("Is it subset? ¬†", nums.issubset(oddNums))

#if the set is a superset of another set
print("Is it superset? ¬†", nums.issuperset(oddNums))

# remove single item
grade.remove('D')
print("Remove() ¬†",grade)

# remove single item from a set without raising an error
grade.discard('X')
print("Discard () ¬†",grade)

# remove any random item from a set
deleted_item = grade.pop()
print("Pop() ¬†", deleted_item)

# remove all items
grade.clear()
print("Remove all items", grade)

#Update a list to set
upd=[3,'45',34]
grade.update(upd)
print("Updated set : ", grade)

# delete a set
del grade



#SET OPERATIONS

#Union-produces a new set containing all the distinct elements from two sets
set1={1,2,3}
set2={2,3,4,5}
print("Union Using |", set1|set2)
print("Union Using union()", set1.union(set2))

#Intersect- produces a new set containing only the common elements from two sets
print(" Intersect Using &", set1&set2)
print("Intersect Using intersection()",set1.intersection(set2))

#Difference- produces a new set containing only the elements from the first set and none from the second set
print("Difference using - : ",set1-set2)
print("Difference using difference()",set1. difference(set2))

#Symmetric Difference- Return the elements of both sets which is not common.
print("Symmetric Difference using -",set1^set2)
print("Symmetric Difference using symmetric_difference()",set1.symmetric_difference(set2))

title: Lab#3: Demonstrate the Feature Scaling (MinMaxScaler and StandardScaler)
description:
Download the dataset as per your domain of research from the available online repositories. The dataset must have a minimum of 50 rows and 5 columns. Perform the following operations on the dataset:
1. Importing the libraries
2. Importing the dataset
3. Taking care of missing data
4. Splitting the dataset into the Training set and Test set
5. Feature Scaling (MinMaxScaler)
6. Feature Scaling (StandardScaler)
7. Heatmap for correlation
8. Boxplot to compare values within groups

The regular lab program carries 10 marks and the Evaluation Rubrics for each program is given below:¬†¬†

Ontime Submission (2 marks)
Correctness of the program (3 marks)¬† ¬†
Visualization¬†(Preprocessing/Plots/Evaluation Metrics)¬†(2 marks)¬†¬†
Concept Clarity (3 marks)
Output file:
Code file (python file) and Solution file (Word or PDF file) with your observations¬†
[Or]
Colab/Jupyter notebook file (with code and output sequence)¬†with your observations¬†

Online repositories:
https://scikit-learn.org/

sklearn.preprocessing.StandardScaler:

https://scikit-learn.org/stable/modules/generated/sklearn.preprocessing.StandardScaler.html

sklearn.preprocessing.MinMaxScaler:

https://scikit-learn.org/stable/modules/generated/sklearn.preprocessing.MinMaxScaler.html

title: LAB #13 - WORKING WITH NOSQL - AWS DYNAMODB
description:
Task: Create a table and retrieve some information.
Step I - Create Table
1. Go to DynamoDB
2. Click create table (Table name and primary key)
(Table name - orders; primary key - orderID)
3. Keep the defaults and click create.

Step II - Add records (Items)
4. After table creation, Click Items tab.
5. Click Create item 1
Enter value for orderID - 1
5a. Append attribute (ordername - string)
5b. Orderitems (list - paper, pen)
5c. Save
6. Create Item - 2¬†
¬† ¬†(orderID, orderdate string, status boolean -true)
7. Create Item - 3
¬† ¬†(orderID, ordername string, orderstatus boolean -false)

Step III - Retrieving data from the DB
8. Scan table¬†
9. Scan table with filter
ordername string contains order
(column name should be specified as it is created)
10. Query the table
Must give partition key with value
11. Query the table with filter
Must give partition key¬†
Any filter attribute with it's datatype along with the value should be given.
Example:
orderstatus boolean true

title: LAB#11 INTRODUCTION TO GOOGLE APPENGINE
description:
Hosting a static website using Google AppEngine



Steps:



1. Search App Engine API



2. Enable App Engine API



3. Download and unzip "sample-app"



4. Open Google Cloud Shell.



5. Drag and drop the sample-app folder into the left pane of the code editor.



6. Run the following in the commands:



¬† ¬† ¬†6 a. gcloud config set project <Project ID>



¬† ¬† ¬†6 b. cd sample-app



¬† ¬† ¬†6 c. gcloud app deploy



7.Enter a number to choose the region where you want your application located.



8. Enter 'Y' to confirm.

gcloud browse app


9. Browse your-project-id.appspot.com to see your website online.

title: LAB #6 - LAUNCH A STATIC WEBSITE USING AWS EC2 AND AWS S3
description:
---- Do it in AWS ACF Sandbox environment ----



Task 1 - Create EC2 instance



1. AMI - Amazon Linux AMI

2. Type - t2.micro

3. Save a keypair¬†


4. Configure Security group as follows:

{

SSH - custom - 0.0.0.0/0

HTTP - custom - 0.0.0.0/0

HTTPS - custom - 0.0.0.0/0¬†

}

5. Launch the instance



Task 2 - Create a bucket in S3 to store the web files

1. Create a Bucket in S3¬†

2.Object Ownership: Choose ACLs enabled & Object writer

3. Uncheck Block public access & Accept the warning

3. Create the bucket

4. Upload web files (files are available in¬†‚Äúfiles.zip")

5. Goto your bucket and then to Objects. Select all the files then¬†Choose Actions ‚Äî> ¬†Make public
6. CopyURL of the objects one by one




Task 3: Connect using Connect option in EC2



Task 4: Run Apache server¬†

Execute the following commands:

1.¬†sudo su

2. yum update -y

3. yum install httpd -y

4. cd /var/www/html

6. wget object URL (Click the file in the bucket and get the URL (Ex: index.html click and get the URL)

7. Copy the files one by one as step 5 ¬†(wget remaining¬† 3 files)

8. service httpd start

9. Go to instance; copy IP address and paste it in the new window.


Your site will be up!!

Submit the screenshot of the webpage along with the IPV4 address.

title: LAB #5 - STORAGE SERVICE
description:
LAUNCH A STATIC WEBSITE USING AWS S3:

Steps to be followed:

Go to S3

1. Create Bucket (Name: samples3site)

2. Allow unchecking Block all public access. (Accept the warning)

3. Permissions -> Bucket Policy.

4. Edit Bucket policy

paste:

{

¬† ¬† "Version": "2012-10-17",

¬† ¬† "Statement": [

¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† {

¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† "Sid": "PublicReadGetObject",

¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† "Effect": "Allow",

¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† "Principal": "*",

¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† "Action": "s3:GetObject",

¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† "Resource": "arn:aws:s3:::samples3site/*"

¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† }

¬† ¬† ]

}

5. Create your static site pages (You create some simple web pages using HTML. Find attachment (site.rar) of a simple web pages. But you create your own pages)

6. Upload static website files to an AWS S3 bucket

8. Open the bucket and navigate to properties

9. Scroll down to "static website hosting" is disabled. Click on the box and do the following configurations.

Select option ‚Äì Use this bucket to host a website

Specify the index document name. (Ex: index.html)

Specify the error document name.¬†(Ex: error.html)

10. note-down the Amazon S3 website endpoint and access the site.





Output: Submit a word document with snapshot of your website after launching. The document should contain the URL.

title: CIA3 - Assignment
description:
1.Create a XML for the library management system and validate the file using xml schema and also display the data in table format with the header of "Library Management System" using XSLT

2.Christ University has asked you to create an XHTML document that allows potential students to provide feedback about their campus visit. Your XHTML document should contain a form with text boxes for a name, address and e-mail. Provide check boxes that allow prospective students to indicate what they liked most about the campus. These check boxes should include: student, location, campus, atmosphere, dorm rooms and sports.Also, provide radio button that ask the prospective student how they became interested in the university. Option should include: friends,television, Internet and other.Inaddition, provide a text area for additional comments,
a submit button and reset button. Write a javascript to do basic form validations.

code to perform the following operations with proper validations
ÔÇ∑ Insert
ÔÇ∑ Update
ÔÇ∑ Delete
ÔÇ∑ Search the particular student based on their id
ÔÇ∑ Display the student id and name whose course is BCA
